meanings.meaning: 1. place; spot; scene; site also pronounced どころ when a suffixさあ、今汲みなさい。そして宴会の世話役の所に持っていきなさい。Now draw some out and take it to the master of the banquet.
2. address Usually written using kana alone
3. district; area; locality Usually written using kana alone
4. one's house Usually written using kana alone「そのうちに、あなたのところにお邪魔してもいいですか」「どうぞ、どうぞ」"Do you mind if I call on you sometime?" "No, not at all."
5. point; aspect; side; facet Usually written using kana alone, See also いいとこ驚かない所をみると知ってたのね。Seeing that you're not surprised, I think you must have known.
6. passage (in text); part Usually written using kana alone
7. space; room Usually written using kana alone
8. thing; matter Usually written using kana aloneおじを見送りに駅に行ってきたところだ。I have been to the station to see my uncle off.
9. whereupon; as a result Usually written using kana alone, after the plain past form of a verbあっ、いけない！忘れるところだった！Oh, no! I almost forgot!
10. about to; on the verge of Usually written using kana alone, after present form of a verb
11. was just doing; was in the process of doing; have just done; just finished doing Usually written using kana alone, after past form of a verb
12. approximately; around; about Usually written using kana alone, after a quantity + が
処 【ところ】、所 【とこ】

sentences.translation: Now draw some out and take it to the master of the banquet.
"Do you mind if I call on you sometime?" "No, not at all."
Seeing that you're not surprised, I think you must have known.
I have been to the station to see my uncle off.

1. there; over there; that place; yonder; you-know-where Usually written using kana alone, See also どこ, See also ここ, See also そこ, place physically distant from both speaker and listenerあそこから人影が見えた。A form appeared from over there.

2. genitals; private parts; nether regions Colloquial, Usually written using kana alone, Euphemistic, Only applies to あそこ, Only applies to あすこ, Only applies to アソコ先生、アソコがかゆいんです。Doctor, I've got an itch in my crotch.
3. that far; that much; that point Usually written using kana alone, See also あれほど, something psychologically distant from both speaker and listener
